content_parts.title: Edit dimensions and projected stock for purchasing and sales documents

content_parts.content: You can access dimensions and projected stock from the More actions icon.
When you add lines from a purchase requisition to a purchase order, you can update the Quantities to order field at the same time.

content_parts.title: Attribute and dimension updates on source documents

content_parts.content:
When a stock journal entry does not transfer successfully to Sage Intacct due to incorrect attribute and dimension assignments, you can correct the assignments on the original stock receipt. From the Notification history page, you can access the source document and make corrections as needed.

After making corrections, you can resend the document.

You can generate and assign serial numbers to components and products as needed. You can manage serial numbers for multiple applications: 

  • Item updates

Use serial numbers to identify material items and track their movements throughout the entire supply chain.

  • Generation of serial numbers on stock receipt 

Serial numbers are automatically generated on stock receipt for serial number managed items. The numbers are defined according to the serial number sequence setup linked to the item.

  • Receipt of supplier serial numbers

You can assign serial numbers provided by suppliers at the point of receiving or issuing stock to stock items. A new line action on the stock receipt and stock issue page opens a new screen to assign these serial numbers and validate the assignment.

  • Work orders 

Select the Pregenerate serial number for work order checkbox for a routing to pregenerate serial numbers when a work order is released for production. You can view the pregenerated serial numbers from the work order.
You can manually assign serial numbers to a work order and remove serial numbers from a work order if there is a discrepancy between the work order planned quantity and the completed quantity. 

  • Stocks

Serial numbers for items issued from stock can be retained if the item is received back into stock. 

You can link serial numbers to a stock count. The serial numbers are posted with the counted item when the stock count is posted.

  • Allocate serial numbers

You can assignment serial numbers to stock allocations for items that are serial number managed. For documents for an issue from stock, such as a sales shipment, the prior allocation of stock and serial numbers is required. For other documents, such as sales orders, the prior allocation of stock and serial numbers is required.

  • Sales shipment

When you create a sales shipment, serial numbers that are allocated on sales order lines are transferred to the sales shipment lines.
When you delete a sales shipment line or deallocate stock, serial numbers linked to the deleted line are automatically deallocated. 

  • Issue existing serial numbers

On the Stock issue, Material tracking, and Stock adjustment pages, you can enter existing serial numbers when issuing stock to a single, serialized stock item. On the Stock adjustment page, you can select serial numbers for items of source locations that need to be moved to 1 to multiple target locations.

content_parts.title: Order to order for manufactured items

content_parts.content: You can automatically create a work order from a confirmed sales order in the item-site record for a manufactured item. The production receipt corresponding to the work order does not automatically allocate the sales order line.

content_parts.title: Standard cost variance and journal posting

content_parts.content: When you use standard cost accounting, standard cost variance postings are generated to reconcile standard costs with the actual purchase costs. You can define the GL accounts per posting class to reflect the purchase variances.

content_parts.title: Item description defaults to item name

content_parts.content: When you create a sales order or a sales invoice, the item description defaults to the item name if you don’t enter a description.

You have the option to display the item ID in these grids. Because it does not display by default, you need to select it in the column panel.

  • Purchase order lines grid
  • Item-site main list
  • Routing main list
  • Bill of materials main list and components grid
  • Work order main list and components grid

You can enter Internal notes on the Customer page.
You can enter Internal and External notes on the Sales order page at the header and line levels.
The Sales order confirmation PDF includes the external notes from the document header and the document lines.

You can enter Internal notes on the Supplier page.
You can enter Internal and External notes on the Purchase requisition, Purchase order, Purchase receipt, and Purchase credit memo pages at the header and line levels.
On the Purchase order page, the Supplier delivery mode and Buyer are displayed.
The Purchase order PDF includes the following additional information: delivery mode, expected delivery date, and external notes from the document header and the document lines.

content_parts.content:
You can use simplified import templates to load data from your previous application quickly.
Sage delivers simplified import templates for the following elements:

  • Business entities
  • Companies
  • Items
  • Suppliers
  • Customers
  • Item suppliers, customers, and allergens
  • Daily and weekly shifts
  • Shift details
  • Capability levels
  • Sites
  • Labor and tool resources
  • Bills of materials

content_parts.title: View main list items by group

content_parts.content: You can group records in the list for columns that can display multiple values, such as a status or reference data. When you select the grouping option, records are sorted by category, and you can see the number of records per category.

You can export content in the main list to an Excel or CSV file.

  • The export is not limited to what is visible on the page. 
  • List filters apply to the export.
  • Exporting without filters can cause a time-out error because the file is too large.

You can upload files such as images and fonts to use as references in the stylesheet or HTML report layout.
For example, you can include a company logo in every document with a unique reference to an image or use a font not present in the system.

You can create 2 types of widgets with the dashboard wizard:

  • Tile widgets with grouped data
  • List widgets

You can select:

  • A main data source
  • A list of properties to use
  • Filters based on selected properties and the conditions associated with them

For tiles, you can define:

  • The displayed value
  • The grouping method: count, minimum, maximum, or sum

For lists, you can define:

  • The sorting order
  • The columns displayed
